item.source: HEYYYY, IPod nano finally gets a screen!

item.title: HEYYYY, IPod nano finally gets a screen!
item.dc:creator: k3nny1550
item.description:
Fnoigy:

Why the hell do you have two?

Nano 2G I got a while ago. Haven’t been using it.

Touch 32 has just about all my music on it. Since the external HDD that I was storing the music on got fucked, it’s my only storage medium for it left. Plus I watched movies on it during plane or extended car trips. That’s how I saw “Southland Tales,” “Training Day,” and “Watchmen Director’s Cut.” All of which were pretty good movies.

Read full topic

item.source: HEYYYY, IPod nano finally gets a screen!

item.title: HEYYYY, IPod nano finally gets a screen!
item.dc:creator: OldDirtyBastard
item.description:
Pyro:

Honestly, it seems so small that it’s not that useful. There’s not much it makes easier. I mean, when you’re browsing through a list of songs, wouldn’t it be easier to use buttons? And won’t you be blocking the screen 1/4th of the time?

It’s still 1.5x bigger than shuffle, and the icons are the same scale as touch.

I see no problems here, he holds it in one hand and his fingers are quite meaty.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=69kEqPCI1VI

Stop judging the shit because you never saw it IRL. The most funniest and ridiculous thing is that every single IRL buddy of mine who bashes new apple products on a regular basis, two weeks later I find them playing around with the stuff like kids.

Also,
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mCMLnrJz_bg&feature=related
Writswatch, wristwatch.

Read full topic
item.source: HEYYYY, IPod nano finally gets a screen!

that’s 17.5

ipod 1g, 2g, 3g, 4g, video (5g) 5.5g, 6g (classic), mini, photo, nano, shuffle, all I know is that there is a shitload

jerry:

99$? :3

it’s more like $399

item.source: HEYYYY, IPod nano finally gets a screen!

item.title: HEYYYY, IPod nano finally gets a screen!
item.dc:creator: Pyroclase
item.description:
OldDirtyBastard:

You’d so love to believe that, wouldn’t you?

https://images.apple.com/ipodnano/images/overview_featurette_design20100901.png
https://images.apple.com/ipodnano/images/overview_featurette_features20100901.png

I hate to disappoint you, but you can clearly put 4 fingers on the screen at the same time. Small wonder, since it’s size is one of a belt buckle.

Honestly, it seems so small that it’s not that useful. There’s not much it makes easier. I mean, when you’re browsing through a list of songs, wouldn’t it be easier to use buttons? And won’t you be blocking the screen 1/4th of the time?

Read full topic
item.source: HEYYYY, IPod nano finally gets a screen!

item.title: HEYYYY, IPod nano finally gets a screen!

sersoft:

first of all, devoted apple fans can have up to 18.5 iPods, 8.5 iPod generations plus 6 nanos and 3 shuffles, and besides, they are completely different, the nano 2G is alot better because it can run Rockbox, the touch is completely useless apart from downloading porn over wifi

that’s 17.5

item.title: HEYYYY, IPod nano finally gets a screen!
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
some guy found an iphone on the side of the road today, it was smashed to hell and it was raining so he brought it to me, apparently the only damaged part is the LCD and digitizer, which I’m gonna get for 30$ off ebay. The back cover had a hard plastic case so it doesn’t have a single scratch on it and it’s a 16gb 3Gs now that’s worthy of a Fuck Yeah!

edit: pics

item.source: HEYYYY, IPod nano finally gets a screen!

item.title: HEYYYY, IPod nano finally gets a screen!
item.dc:creator: Fnoigy
item.description:
k3nny1550:

Hang on guys, my two iPods are practically bullet proof. My nano 2G was one durable piece of hardware, and I decided not to take chances with my Touch 2G and bought a case for it so it’s not an issue. But yeah, the devices have been pretty reliable for me, surviving many drops to hard pavement and years in my pants pockets.

Why the hell do you have two?

Read full topic
item.source: HEYYYY, IPod nano finally gets a screen!

item.title: HEYYYY, IPod nano finally gets a screen!
item.dc:creator: garrthbarrttinn
item.description:
k3nny1550:

Hang on guys, my two iPods are practically bullet proof. My nano 2G was one durable piece of hardware, and I decided not to take chances with my Touch 2G and bought a case for it so it’s not an issue. But yeah, the devices have been pretty reliable for me, surviving many drops to hard pavement and years in my pants pockets.

I don’t think his post was a stab at apple, it was just ridiculing the idea of making a touchscreen mp3 watch.

Read full topic
